title: >>> NIGHT of the FASTBALLS
body_text:
One is a blocking and dodging icon who has accomplished more than most in his year-long plus tenure as a dodgeball athlete. The other is a crafty, agile, and all-around gifted warrior who never walks away from a fight. Dodgeball's past, for one night only, re-emerged into the spotlight that made them great.
Spengeman vs. Carty
Derek was fired and raring to go, taking on all comers in the opening game of DODGEBALL 89. Game 2 brought along the same success, and though it wasn't easy, Team CARTY earned yet another victory resulting in a 2 to 0 lead. But that's when things turned ugly.
Team SPENGEMAN had seen enough and weren't going to allow such physical abuse to continue. Game 3 put Dan on the board. Game 4, the same conclusion, now with the score deadlocked at 2 a piece. And it was this very momentum that would carry Team SPENGEMAN through the night, signaling the demise of Team CARTY.
This one was a blow out as "QuickSand" Dan took home 6 games to Derek's 2. An unfortunate, record-setting fifth loss for the high-flyer. Dan just ran with it.
Moments & Stars
: Rob Avakian's exceptional dodging; the agile and rather colorful Joey Smalls; Kevin Adams toughing it out, competing with an injury
F'ed Up Fingers
And just when you thought Kevin Adams was the only one suffering too ...
Earlier this week, it was reported that the youngest Adams suffered a serious ligament tear in his right pinky finger at the 88th dodgeball spectacular. But the same pain and anguish didn't stop there as at DODGEBALL 89, two past victims of last summer's dreaded broken finger plague left with severely swollen fingers yet again. The self-made "referee" Diana DiBuccio and fierce catcher Mike "Sputz" are wished the best, hopefully walking away with no sidelining injury.
Records of 89
> Attendance: 23
> Notable Returns: Will Colucci (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 39); Dan Spengeman (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 80)
> New Players: (3) Jim Delany, Nick Delisa, Simon Poalillo
- This was the first odd-numbered Season 9 event that was not a
Wet War
.
- DODGEBALL 89 returned to the back courts of Wall High School with inclusion of Human Rims.
- Derek Carty added another loss to his "perfect" dodgeball captains career. Carty is now 0-5-0; the first person to ever lose five singles matches. As for Dan Spengeman, he remains unbeaten in singles competition, with an impressive 3-0-0, and an overall record of 3-1-0.
- Surpisingly, there were only two women present at DODGEBALL 89; Sara DeCuir and Diana DiBuccio. This was the lowest female turnout since November's DODGEBALL 62.
________________________________________
____
The time for talking is over. Two of the sports framers take their rightful place in the main event of the 90th dodgeball extravaganza. The respected court general
Justin Pierce
will meet all-star
Tom Adams
in this soon-to-be classic.
The Biggest Announcement Ever!
Let's just say the countdown to
DODGEBALL 100
has begun. Best be sure to check
dodgeball.livejournal.com
in the coming days.
Official preview for
Pierce/Adams
and information on the special music compilation will be released very soon. All this and more leading up to the titantic-sized event,
DODGEBALL 90
!

One is a blocking and dodging icon who has accomplished more than most in his year-long plus tenure as a dodgeball athlete. The other is a crafty, agile, and all-around gifted warrior who never walks away from a fight. Dodgeball's past, for one night only, re-emerged into the spotlight that made them great.

Spengeman vs. Carty
Derek was fired and raring to go, taking on all comers in the opening game of DODGEBALL 89. Game 2 brought along the same success, and though it wasn't easy, Team CARTY earned yet another victory resulting in a 2 to 0 lead. But that's when things turned ugly.

Team SPENGEMAN had seen enough and weren't going to allow such physical abuse to continue. Game 3 put Dan on the board. Game 4, the same conclusion, now with the score deadlocked at 2 a piece. And it was this very momentum that would carry Team SPENGEMAN through the night, signaling the demise of Team CARTY.

This one was a blow out as "QuickSand" Dan took home 6 games to Derek's 2. An unfortunate, record-setting fifth loss for the high-flyer. Dan just ran with it.

Moments & Stars: Rob Avakian's exceptional dodging; the agile and rather colorful Joey Smalls; Kevin Adams toughing it out, competing with an injury

F'ed Up Fingers
And just when you thought Kevin Adams was the only one suffering too ... Earlier this week, it was reported that the youngest Adams suffered a serious ligament tear in his right pinky finger at the 88th dodgeball spectacular. But the same pain and anguish didn't stop there as at DODGEBALL 89, two past victims of last summer's dreaded broken finger plague left with severely swollen fingers yet again. The self-made "referee" Diana DiBuccio and fierce catcher Mike "Sputz" are wished the best, hopefully walking away with no sidelining injury.

Records of 89
> Attendance: 23
> Notable Returns: Will Colucci (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 39); Dan Spengeman (Last appearance at DODGEBALL 80)
> New Players: (3) Jim Delany, Nick Delisa, Simon Poalillo

- This was the first odd-numbered Season 9 event that was not a Wet War.
- DODGEBALL 89 returned to the back courts of Wall High School with inclusion of Human Rims.
- Derek Carty added another loss to his "perfect" dodgeball captains career. Carty is now 0-5-0; the first person to ever lose five singles matches. As for Dan Spengeman, he remains unbeaten in singles competition, with an impressive 3-0-0, and an overall record of 3-1-0.
- Surpisingly, there were only two women present at DODGEBALL 89; Sara DeCuir and Diana DiBuccio. This was the lowest female turnout since November's DODGEBALL 62.
____________________________________________

The time for talking is over. Two of the sports framers take their rightful place in the main event of the 90th dodgeball extravaganza. The respected court general Justin Pierce will meet all-star Tom Adams in this soon-to-be classic.

The Biggest Announcement Ever!
Let's just say the countdown to DODGEBALL 100 has begun. Best be sure to check dodgeball.livejournal.com in the coming days.

Official preview for Pierce/Adams and information on the special music compilation will be released very soon. All this and more leading up to the titantic-sized event, DODGEBALL 90!
